title: Mythological Illustrations
description: A series shaped by ancient belief and the whispered memory of folklore. These works draw from Nordic spirits, Greek tragedies, Roman omens, and South Asian oral traditions. Each painting becomes a small theatre of myth—where devotion, sacrifice, and transformation blur between the natural and the divine. The pieces are layered in watercolor, gouache, and gold, continuing the miniature tradition while weaving in a contemporary sense of silence, symbolism, and atmospheric depth.

paintings.name: Røde Liljer
paintings.materials: Gouache, gold leaf, handmade wasli paper
paintings.process: Layered translucent washes, micro-detailing, dry-brush textures inspired by Nordic botanical motifs.
paintings.description: From the forests of Tiveden comes the tale of Fagertärn, where the lilies bloom red. A fisherman once bargained with the nøkken, promising his daughter in exchange for plentiful catches. When her eighteenth year arrived, she walked to the lake—not to surrender, but to choose her fate. She pierced her heart and fell into the water, turning the lilies crimson. The painting captures this quiet defiance, where sacrifice becomes legend and beauty is born of grief.

paintings.name: A Musical Sacrifice
paintings.process: Wet-on-dry layers, dotted detailing, soft petal-stroke textures.
paintings.description:
I heard enchanted music, loud and clear,
And so I came to listen for a while.
Hopeless, carrying darkness inside,
There he was—a stranger to my eyes.

He played as if he knew my despair,
Each note cutting silence, each stroke telling my story.
I prayed he would finish, but he played on,
Unyielding, strong, a bow that sang like spirit.

From the deep it echoed—
The legend of Fossegrim,
The water spirit who sacrifices to master the violin,
Binding sorrow to beauty for eternity.

paintings.name: Skyie
paintings.process: Wet-on-dry layers, dotted detailing, soft sky-tone blending.
paintings.description: Inspired by Norse skies, this piece recalls the canopy of Yggdrasil—the celestial veil that stretches over gods and mortals. Skyie reflects the shimmering boundary between realms, where the heavens rest lightly upon the world tree.

paintings.name: Hulder
paintings.process: Wet-on-dry layers, micro-detailing, soft organic textures.
paintings.description: In Norwegian folklore, the Hulder wanders the forest—radiant from the front, hollow like rotting wood from behind. She sings to lure travelers off the path, embodying the seduction and danger hidden within wild nature.

paintings.name: Leda
paintings.process: Gouache highlights, fluid line work, mythic composition.
paintings.description: Leda, queen of Sparta, was visited by Zeus in the form of a swan. Their union brought forth children of mortal and divine lineage—among them Helen of Troy, whose destiny ignited a war. The painting evokes this moment where divinity touches mortality, altering the course of legend.

paintings.name: Flora's Timeless Garden
paintings.process: Soft floral washes, layered botanical detailing, pastel blending.
paintings.description: Roman mythology honors Flora, goddess of spring and flowers. Her garden blooms endlessly with lilacs, lavender, and butterflies—symbols of renewal, forgiveness, and the gentle surrender to nature’s rhythms.

paintings.name: The Plea
paintings.process: Wet-on-dry layers, atmospheric shading, narrative composition.
paintings.description: An Indian legend speaks of elephants who once carried wings. One rested upon a great tree and crashed down upon a meditating yogi. Angered, the yogi cursed the wings away. Since then, elephants walk the earth—heavy, grounded, and forever longing for the sky they once knew.

paintings.name: The Lady on Moon
paintings.process: Soft lunar gradients, fine detailing, flowing ink lines.
paintings.description: Echoing the tale of Chang’e, the moon goddess, this piece envisions a woman who ascended to the moon. She carries longing, lightness, and the quiet immortality that hangs between earth and sky.

paintings.name: The Cursed Flower Princess
paintings.process: Bloom-layering, soft petal textures, narrative framing.
paintings.description: A forgotten tale tells of a princess cursed to bloom as a flower each night. Her petals hide sorrow; her fragrance carries longing. Only a selfless act can break the spell, tying her fate to the cycles of dusk and dawn.

paintings.name: The Flying Thoughts
paintings.process: Feather-light strokes, layered gradients, symbolic detailing.
paintings.description: Inspired by mythic muses, this piece reflects the whispers of inspiration carried by unseen spirits. Like Hermes’ wings or Odin’s ravens, they move swiftly between realms, guiding mortals toward imagination and creation.
